text: Have you ever noticed — no theory truly begins from nothing. Every doctrine, every explanation, starts with an axiom : a foundational assumption, an article of belief we accept without proof. It lies outside logic, beyond questioning, not because it’s irrefutable — but because we choose to treat it as the ground from which all else can grow. We are taught to “believe” these axioms — not to prove them, but to trust them. Upon these initial leaps of faith, logic constructs vast architectures. One layer supports the next, and those “superstructures” give rise to even more complex frameworks — “super-superstructures,” if you will — until eventually, we declare: We understand. But what is this process, really? Is learning just the act of finding the missing links between ideas we’ve already agreed to believe in? Is it the acceptance of new connections as long as they don’t threaten the foundations we’ve inherited? And so the question deepens: Do we ever truly learn anything new? Or are we simply wandering the corridors of an already-built palace, discovering rooms we hadn’t noticed before — rooms built atop assumptions we never laid ourselves? Is there anything new to learn — or only new ways to believe?

text: So , the thing is , I have an issue in my life and am looking for its solution , tried everywhere so I  just though leme try here too ,maybe it would be worth putting. This post is going to be quite off topic as its category and will be very long so read only if u like reading and have some spare time , had been procrastinating to write but don’t have any other option left ( also do leme know if it infringes any policies will delete asap) . So as my roll no hints that I m from may 2023 batch , but I m still in my foundation lvl , probably the worst phase of my life . The thing is I am  a PMO addict since I was just a kid (indirect to direct) due to bad company and inner curiosity . Leme cover BG:  Raised up in a middle class family in Mumbai  Slums and both of my parents work so I used to stay alone at home and TV,phone,PC aggravated my condition . i realized there itself but was quite young to make any judgement and kept on doing as it was giving me joy , and my inquisitiveness was growing day by day making it more natural to me . I tried to stop in between but was quite undetermined though the frequency was lesser that time , time passed by and so its data in my mind which used to give me flashbacks everytime I tried to give up it , then came my  10 boards , as was easy so I somehow scored 90% , my parents were happy( me too but I felt could have done better) and with this thought we decided to give a try to JEE ,  I had thought will study seriously  but due to corona(2020-21)  had to come to village so my foundations were quite weak , gave boards but managed only 66% ,(gave improvement , didn’t work as went to kota , travelling and more)  I barely passed maths  ( the addiction was one of major reasons) I still thought of giving one more try so my parents sent me to kota by taking loan , I was quite pressurized cuz even in such a situation I was not able to quit my addiction ( loneliness , other studs enoying , homesickness , OVERTHINKING , laziness etc) .  I attended all the lectures and did studied hard but drop year is something very tough if u didn’t study much in 11-12th  , I mastered chemistry and physics too to some extent , but couldn’t do maths , though scored fine in mains but failed in adv .  But then news came that 75% is back so my NIT dreams too got thrashed , I thought everything ended for me except a pvt clg on another loan but then I got to know about this degree ( very thankful to IITM) took admission before adv . I am in a village in Up now ( little issues like family stuffs and light though excuses) . Now I decided to focus completely on this degree but ( my strong parts chem and phy are of no use to me know ) and I struggled with maths and stats even programming as its new to me . It’s my 6th term of foundation now, the last hope . leme breakdown: 1st T : all 4 subs jee based   couldn’t study  adv and travelling             2n T : became campus ambassador , but passed with 6 cgpa ,   3rdT : stats2 , maths 2 , Python , couldn’t study well due to addiction , ,illness  and OPPE so thought  lets do all 3 to improve CGPA 4th Term : all 3 again OPPE halted me ,  5th Term : all 3 + CT impr( improved only 1 grade) , 6th current Term : all 3 + stats 1 impr  ,   whatever I have done in my life this addiction has always been a part of it ( though other factors too but this was the major one) I read tons of articles , saw 100s of recovery videos , read books like easy peasy method , used blockers and extensions , started exercise and meditation  but being from tech always found a way to escape through  ,  I do it every 2nd or 3 day on avg ( sometimes more than once) now I feel like I was wasted my life so far cuz I am 20 now , became twice junior to my batchmates ,  can’t see any way ,    being in a community with so many people who are somewhat successful and at least doing something better , I beg u all to plz suggest me something , rebuke me , abuse me , do whatever but I literally wanna get out of this trap and wanna do something better in my life , I don’t use social media nor any other thing like cricket but this thing … I am quite ashamed to write  … but I feel maybe someone’s experience might help me  esp of experienced people like Anand sir , Karthik sir . If u read till here then I thank u with all my heart and wish u more success in life ! Thanks again .

text: 23f2001123: bs jee based couldn’t study adv and Hey there!! I’m Bharadwaj. You know, we all have hard phases in life where we have to go through troublesome incidents and a lot of being ashamed of ourselves along with self doubt (this one sticks hard!). You might have tried to improve your situations by your actions but they might have fallen short. You might not have been able to achieve what you set out to achieve. It happens. It happens to everyone bro. It happened even to me! But don’t worry. Let’s start with small steps. Don’t set goals like I want to pass maths 2 or stats 2. It’s a bit a vague, but rather tell yourself that you’re going to learn the concepts of Maths 2 and Stats 2. Try other programming resources like w3schools or freecodecamp.org or even apna college youtube channel. They teach you very well. I’m open to help you bro! Because I understand that you want to grow and prove yourself, not to anyone, but you. I get that you’re feeling low in your life now, but this too shall pass. I recommend listening to few self help episodes  ‘Daily Wisdom’. They kind of help you. Even I’m starting out my offline college, so i understand the 11th and 12th phase. I know that I’ve never met you. I don’t know whether this helps you, just know that there are people who are facing the same phase of life with you right now. We just don’t share it out loud. It doesn’t mean that we’re not hurting. Start some physical activities like walking, jogging or even running and exercise. They’ll help you keep positive thoughts about yourself. I can’t guarantee that feeling positive about yourself will help you make your situations better, but I can guarantee you that feeling worst about yourself WILL MAKE  your situations even worse. You will having a thriving life in future, just persevere this hard phase. LIFE IS GOOD BRO, give it some time. HAVE A GREAT DAY ahead !!!

text: @23f2001123 As with any addiction, there are varying degrees. Some people find success in overcoming it by themselves with a drastic change of routine and such. But in particular cases, when one genuinely feels like nothing they have tried is working, professional intervention might be needed. While the collective wisdom of a forum like this is sufficiently motivating, you might have to seek medical help. Subject to financial constraints, talk to a psychiatrist. Of course, listen to what others have to say here, but seeking professional help just might be the best option for you as they are likely to be far more experienced and qualified to help you than folk who are themselves relatively “doing well”.

text: Is this the real problem? The addiction you are taking about is surely a issue , but it cannot be a issue so overwhelming as you said. How can addiction make you poor in mathematics but good in physics n chemistry?! I would personally not like to correlate your addiction to your performance in IIT M. But I guess there are other factors involved , maybe your lonely, depressed , abuse for some reasons and that’s is where the problem lies. Or maybe you simply don’t like these subjects , this is not ur forte. Whatever is the reason you have to figure it out.Even maybe the things are tough for u , and your brain is not liking to work harder. Though the addiction affects and harm you education, but years after years it spiralling you down seems little exaggerated. It may not be porn specifically but what triggers it , why the trigger is question! Find out the reasons which actually doesn’t allow you to focus when u are studying, what happens when you start studying, what difficulty do you face during studying etc etc? List them, work on them…this platform I would say you would have to best kind of support… People go out of the way to help each other to study Coming to the addiction part. It is like a chain , it has a trigger, action and reaction. These goes on… Here is an example of how it works… Maybe your in your room alone the privacy is the trigger, your brain wants to be happy always , it needs dopamine for it. The brain knows watching porn (lets address it as it should be) will make it happy , it can release the dopamine. So u make the action. Reaction - dopamine release you are happy. The cycle is on. Oh! Remember the dopamine release gets saturated, I mean the body then feels no excitement with the release of a certain amount of it as it is adjusted. So option , release more of it. How? You are more addicted , more things trigger you to watch porn ! So check the trigger points , and try to avoid them. Those cannot be avoid , try  changing the action to the trigger. Do something else , go for a walk , pinch yourself lightly, read a chapter from a good book , write a poetry etc etc. PS: I am not health care professional or related to psychology or its allies fields. Please take the advice as a peer advice and act accordingly. I could strongly recommend you to consult psychiatrist if possible. Public institutions provide for free it finance is a constraint. Try e Sanjeevani of government for free tele medicine consult.

text: Hey there, My name’s Adnan and I completely empathize with your situation. Reading your post, I can see that quite a lot has happened for you and feeling depressed is pretty natural given the circumstances. You’re just 20-21, to be honest - life isn’t ending and you’re just a decision away from an entirely different life. While it can be difficult to combat any form of addiction, especially one you mentioned - Let me tell you it’s not impossible. There are tonnes of practical advice that can be given for quitting addiction, but let me just begin by saying; that ‘its entirely alright, what you’re feeling is natural and with time, it will pass, you will evolve and be a much different person’ Having addressed your need for reassurance, here’s some practical advice Reevaluate your life on a serious note - it’s okay to feel lost, what’s not okay is to give up sight of ‘what’ you want to achieve in the long run. When you’re driven by a solid goal, it’ll become your guiding post, your north star - every time you’re feeling lost, reevaluate with your goals and begin again. Start reading books on how habits are built. All habits - good and bad, are only a set of behaviors that are triggered due to certain cues and indulging in the habit gives you a ‘reward’. You’re a brilliant student, see habits in a scientific manner and you’ll also find a way to alter/break or create new ones. I’ll recommend two good books on habits The Power of Habits - Charles Duhigg Atomic Habits - James Clear Start by reading these, you’ll come out much smarter on how to improve your life Lastly, as cliche as it sounds, life is not a rat race. You have your journey to walk and other have theirs. The grass on the other side always looks greener but the truth is, everyone has their own set of challenges in life. Also don’t forget the massive effort and hard work your parents have put behind you - just to see you succeed in life, and achieve things that were too far-fetched for them. If anything, you have to succeed for them, break the generational curse. Keep your head up, you can do it Here are two cents of advice from someone much older than you. If you feel the need to talk or would like to discuss some practical ways to improve - feel free to drop a message

title: Discourse Topic: 165808 Post 12 by Dan

text: Alright, here’s an answer from broader perspective: The $6 million figure is considered misleading/inaccurate. DeepSeek is backed by a significant sized quantitative hedge fund (High-Flyer Capital Management) and not just some small easier effort. Adding onto the previous point somes compute power. High-Flyer Capital Management had invested in about ~$139M super computer cluster in 2021. Although the number of AI specialized professionals are growing in India its still a smaller fraction compared in the entire IT industry. Dont forget that R1 isn’t the first model which was released by DeepSeek. They have a sustainable overtime development and previous costs aswell. So key takeaway points being: Lack of access to computing infrastructure. Availability of high-quality, datasets. Sustained R&D efforts over time
title: Discourse Topic: 165808 Post 13 by aadit

text: Part 1 Creating a model similar to R1 or o1/o3 is worthwhile, but building a foundational model that delivers true economic value requires more than just money (I’ll return to the money aspect later). It fundamentally requires people—researchers, developers, and engineers in general. (To clarify, I am not driven by patriotism but rather by the pursuit of a peaceful life.) I was particularly frustrated when Sam Altman remarked, on Indian soil, “It’s hopeless to compete with us in foundational models.” I found it disheartening that while he runs a nonprofit and drives a Lamborghini using investor funds—claiming to build AI for humanity—his models remain closed-source and come with pricey premium plans (for example, the recent o3 or 4.5 models require a fee, with a cost equivalent to $200 or roughly 17,500 INR) let’s take benefit of the doubt and say they need money to train new models so they are charging us but then thier research paper for o3/ 4.5 are also not public so it’s not really benefiting the humanity but rather profiting by selling a product and buying Lambo out of it. In contrast, two trillion-dollar companies are run by CEOs of Indian descent, and one of them, Microsoft, has heavily funded OpenAI with billions of dollars. Yet, both leaders ultimately left because they prioritized a peaceful life over nationalist sentiment. To address brain drain, our focus should shift toward providing a high quality of life rather than merely reducing taxes. TL;DR Part 1: We need two things—capital and people. People: China has been preparing for AI since the early 2000s. Many engineers, not just software developers, were already being trained in AI. R1’s success partly comes from solving the problem of training models under sanctions (though we currently do not face such sanctions). Capital: Regarding capital, we possess substantial computing power. Consider the case of DeepSeek R1. Even if there were claims of exaggerating their computing capacity, other researchers would have detected such discrepancies while attempting to replicate their work. Instead, many were able to create a scaled-down clone of R1 for just $4,500 (see deepscaler ). Why We Should Not Focus Solely on Building a Foundational Model: Rather than trying to clone models like R1, o1, o3, Claude 3.7, Grok3, or others, we should adopt a different mindset. Yes, I am aware that China has engaged in controversial practices such as illegally importing banned GPUs (I won’t delve deeply into that as I value my life). Even under sanctions, they managed to build something that surprised the entire AI industry. The U.S. may be trying to prevent other countries from challenging its dominance, but according to R1’s research paper, its founders essentially “coded the GPU in the machine language equivalent” because they were barred from using NVIDIA’s CUDA library. This innovative, first-principles approach allowed them to optimize so effectively that they managed to train their model with only $6 million. You know what’s preventing us , nothing! People have started building in India ( one of them is Sarvam ) but the fact their models can’t even compete with the leading non-reasoning models, so in a way they are useless they don’t really provide any economic value (yet, this experience will grow us soon to compete with tech giants) Conclusion: Instead of focusing on cloning or developing similar models, we should aim to think innovatively and build something significantly better than what we currently have (not only cheaper but smarter). The goal is not merely to replicate existing models but to create a model where, for example, a 70-billion-parameter model could compete with a 500-billion-parameter one—much like Microsoft’s Phi4 compared to GPT-4o or MiniCPM-o (8b) vs GPT4o.

title: Discourse Topic: 162140 Post 6 by LordShanye

text: I remember the first time I stumbled across my existential crisis. It was in my second year of college. It hit me really hard, and I was left with crippling depression for almost two years. During that time, I messed up my academics and lacked the motivation to do pretty much anything. So believe me when I say: I know where you come from. I know the pain you feel. But now, I’m in a much, much better place. Let me explain what that place is and how I got here. This is not a propaganda of any sort. I don’t claim to have answers about anything. These are just musings and wonderings from someone who doesn’t have anything figured out. I just think we need to have more questions in our mind before we think we have answers to even a few. What I’m saying is that conclusions about the world should have a question mark or a comma, instead of a full stop. Now, unlike before, I am willing to accept that a higher power and design in the world is also a possibility. I know what you might be thinking: Just another idiot with baseless hope. (I used to feel the same about anyone who had such ideas when I was struggling with my existential angst in college.) What I think is that any conclusion derived by anybody on the nature of existence is premature. When I was in college, I observed that the foundation of religion was weak and, at times, illogical. I therefore concluded that they were wrong about higher power and design. What I later realized was that I was wrong to stop there and think I had all the answers. So where do we even begin? I think what we lack is an understanding of the extent of complexity of the world we are in. We don’t have the means—or even the mental faculty—to measure the immensity of what is right in front of us. There are so many factors that had to weave together perfectly to realize the laws of nature, which in turn led to the evolution of human, animal, and plant species. We have taken “familiarity” with the world, built after so many interactions, to mean some form of “knowledge” about it. But we were—and still are—children brought into this world with no clue about what is happening. When we logically analyze the world, the right approach should be to start thinking from fundamentals and a zero-knowledge slate. But I don’t think the slate is entirely zero. Look at the laws of the world: light with its colors, matter (just look at the sand we stand on—what even is it?), gravity, sound, the laws of motion, inertia, water, metals, electricity, and so on. Are these just normal things? What if tomorrow we saw a flying, rainbow-colored, singing elephant with horns? Would you say that’s a more surprising and unrealistic occurrence compared to the phenomena and laws of the world I mentioned earlier? Gravity, or any of these natural laws, is way more exotic, unique, and improbable than the flying elephant—by a supreme magnitude of difference. You may call me a romantic, but I believe the existence of these phenomena should contribute to something in our search for answers. So that’s about the things that existed before the evolution of species. What we are currently “logically” assuming is that life simply evolved in this world perfectly—without the help of any external agents or intelligence. Stacks got stacked, screws got fitted, and pieces of the puzzle simply guided themselves into place. But think about it: how vast is the number of neurochemicals and structures that got created by themselves without guidance? We, who jokingly call upon alien intervention in building pyramids or Stonehenge, might be too quick to overlook the possibility of agents behind evolution itself. I’m not questioning this without an alternative in mind. Please check this post: Does God Play Dice? This post explores the possibility that quantum waves, if manipulated, could lead to the control of matter and chemical reactions. Basically, quantum mechanics might enable  capable powers to meddle with evolution. I’ll stop rambling like a fanatic because, if the point I’m trying to make isn’t coming through, talking more won’t help. The point is this: The world is massive, and we, with our small brains, cannot conclude anything yet. When we claim that everything is here by coincidence, we should keep in mind the immensity of that claim—and how many, many factors contributed to that coincidence. It could actually be a magnificent coincidence. But until we have all the answers, every  possibility should remain alive, scientifically explored, and thoughtfully considered. All we have are “opinions” and not truth (including mine). Like I said, I believe it should be a question mark, not a full stop.

text: I hope my reply helped you in some way.  I believe that we can’t say anything about the true nature of reality. Our ideas of the world and how things should be have completely evolved from our experience and exposure to this world and hence limited by that. Why should this world or anything be possible, we don’t know. Truth is we have no data or information as to what the absolute nature of actual reality is or what is possible. Just like a frog in a well not having any information or idea about the outside world. Also here are some ideas I focus on when having existential questions(None of these are absolute or accurate…just ponderings…so take them in with  a  pinch of salt) The age of universe is 13.7 billion years  and age of  human life is approximately 100 years old. So the probability that you exist at  point in time is 100/13.7 billion …which is equal to 1/ hundred million. That level of probability is close metaphorically to odds of finding something you lost in a vast sea at the first place you looked for it(you just looked for it and found  it!). So the case I’m making is that there is more probability that we always existed(as consciousness or whatever) (was searching in the ocean for a long time)   than we just happened to be alive at this point in time. Physical and mathematical laws of nature are intelligence itself(could be thought opposite way that intelligence was derived from nature laws , again just ideas, not accurate). Nature itself is showing  incomprehensibly high level of intelligence in multiple domains. Hence could be  a design. Like I said , these are just ideas that are for the sake of personal exploration. I’m not claiming that they are accurate or correct.

text:
There is no *possibility of  sentience in AI as long as, e.g. we only have pseudo-random processes on computers (till date), not “truly random” random number generators. I am personally quite re-assured that there is no sentience in AI though I understand some are alarmed when it seems, appears as such. Is there a possibility of sentience development in AI in the next 20 - 50 years? Observably sentient, i.e. appearing sentient to external observation, sure. “If it walks like a duck and talks like a duck” — Something engineered or pulled together which talks as intelligently as, say, Jarvis in Iron Man. Provably sentient is but still different. ML models are input-to-output mappings, so it’s proving ‘sentience’ in the mathematical model doing the input to output, inside under the hood. Both the definition of ‘sentience’ in such a setup and the methods of proof for showing are either currently undefined, or not yet known to me. Though we can otherwise easily tell apart between sentience and non-sentience (e.g. dogs vs logs) but a content definition of sentience, which is the one which has to do with the provable part, is not easily had. en.m.wikipedia.org Mind–body problem The mind–body problem is a philosophical problem concerning the relationship between thought and consciousness in the human mind and body. It addresses the nature of consciousness, mental states, and their relation to the physical brain and nervous system. The problem centers on understanding how immaterial thoughts and feelings can interact with the material world, or whether they are ultimately physical phenomena.
 This problem has been a central issue in philosophy of mind since the 17th centu... Whether it’s art, design or language, AI can only move in the grooves available for it in the data. It cannot see beyond it, it’s in that box. So looking outside the box — genuine creativity or originality which humans will appreciate, can be found by humans only. And that originality is worth more, not less, in an age where fluff potentially AI generated becomes more common. For example, AI cannot coin neologisms – like the words ‘start-up’, and ‘Booktique’. Though this might likely change with more examples and clever prompting. Other resources: Precis of The Intentional Stance (Daniel C. Dennett) [Link] A landscape of consciousness: Toward a taxonomy of explanations and implications [Link] Mathematical Proof of Vedanta or No-Go Theorems in Machine Consciousness (Subhash Kak, 2023) [Link] Machine-Assisted Proof (Terence Tao) [Link] | Lecture video Can Large Language Models replace mathematicians? By Tivadar Danka (LinkedIn) How to get started in AI? (Discourse)

text: A disciple approached the Buddha, consumed with anger and a desire for revenge against someone who had wronged him. He asked the Buddha for guidance. The Buddha replied, “Holding onto anger is like grasping a burning coal with the intention of throwing it at someone else; you are the one who gets burned.” For instance, if someone harms you once, their attempt to hurt you is a single act. However, if you keep replaying the incident in your mind, you end up suffering far more than they originally intended. In this way, your own mind causes you greater harm than their actions ever could ( by thinking of revenge). The wisest response is to let go, move on, and focus on living your life.

In our academy they taught us 10 principles of war and out of that one of my favorite is “SELECTION AND MAINTENANCE OF AIM”, The reason I mentioned it is, if anytime you come across any person who has betrayed you or has carried out some action against you, you should pause for a sec or two and do a quick deep analysis as to whether your motive of taking out revenge on that person truly resonates with your purpose, if it doesn’t then silence is the best key to all such wrong motives. Now sometimes the perspective might change and we may consider revenge as the only option to equalize the conflict but again that might lead to your loss of time and energy. So, if that enemy of yours troubles you , just channelize that negative energy expelled by that person to you in order to damage your mindset into positive energy to achieve your target. The satisfaction you get after fulfilling your purpose is much greater than the satisfaction you “might” get after taking revenge(because who knows that person might plan another revenge on you ) So, its better to keep your intentions clean, yes if there is some unlawful things done against you then fight lawfully and confidently.

title: Discourse Topic: 163371 Post 11 by Rahi

text: One day, while a snake was crawling through a tool shed, it brushed against a saw that was on the ground and injured itself. Thinking it was a threat, it snapped back and bit the saw, severely wounding its mouth. Blinded by anger from being hurt, it decided to enact revenge on the saw by suffocating it, so it wrapped around the saw and started squeezing with all its might. The poor snake kept cutting itself on the saw until it died. If only it had ignored the cut and moved on, it would have stayed alive. Moral: When we react viscerally with anger and condemn those who have wronged us, we only end up hurting ourselves. It is sometimes better to ignore some situations and people’s insults because the consequences can be irreversible and catastrophic. Forgive the people who have wronged you. Don’t give them power over you .

title: Discourse Topic: 172636 Post 12 by Sara1

text: Q1: Complete the diploma one at a time or start both diplomas? Ans: It depends on you, if you want to complete both diplomas’ then I would suggest doing them together instead of doing them separately. Q2: What part of foundation will be needed? Ans2: Complete foundation with focus on Maths2, Stats2, Python. Q3: How does project work? Do they teach you how to make project or you just have to make on the basis of the theory courses? And How much time do we have to complete one project? Ans3: You have to do it yourself, there are some guidance session specifically for project by Instructors and TAs and some paid online/offline bootcamps, more details when you register for a project and get along with it, don’t worry. And you have to complete project in that term according to deadlines of each stage informed by the team after you register. Q4: Recommend me the course selection for 4 terms. Ans: MLF, MAD-1, DBMS MLT, BDM, MAD-2 MLP, BA, SC PDSA, TDS, JAVA Project can be taken one per term: (MAD-1, MAD-2, BDM, MLP OR MAD-1, BDM, MAD-2, MLP) OR BDM, DBMS, MLF MLT, SC, MAD-1 MAD-2, MLP, JAVA BA, TDS, PDSA Projects as per your understanding This may not suit you, select accordingly with your modification keeping corequisites and prerequisites in mind. Q5: Should i start early? Ans: Early start is always an advantage, but starting as usual is also not bad, depends on you whether to take break and start OR start early, slow and then pick up the pace (Break is necessary) Q6: The lectures and sessions are enough? Do i need to do anything extra? From any text book? Ans: Lectures and Session were enough for me, but it may not be for everyone, everyone has their preferences, it depends on your understanding and language too. I say, do a little experimenting on how you are able to understand and proceed. And for reference to extra resources, always search on discourse, many people have given many good external resources made by them or found by them. I will be linking them in this post soon. Thanks to @Gurkirat for the possible questions. All are welcomed to suggest course selection and any suggestion on this post.

text: After three days of intense meditation, I returned to the material world and learned something intriguing from my daughter. She told me about a peculiar belief held at her university, NYU. According to her, no student dares to walk under the iconic Washington Square Arch. The superstition claims that doing so would prevent them from graduating within four years. This curious anecdote reminded me of a story I once heard from a friend, long ago: In a remote village in Tamil Nadu, there lived a priest with his daughter and a black cat. After becoming a widower, the priest dedicated himself to performing rituals and ceremonies for the villagers, who relied solely on him for their religious needs. Before conducting a homam (a sacred fire ritual), the priest followed a strict routine. He would ask his daughter to bathe in the backyard stream and bring water for the ritual. She also prepared other materials and was familiar with the entire process. One peculiar detail stood out: just before starting the homam, the priest would always instruct his daughter to tie the black cat to a post. Years later, the priest passed away, and during the mourning period, the black cat also died. When the villagers, finding no one else capable of performing the rituals, turned to the priest’s daughter, they believed she knew all the rites by heart. As she prepared for the homam, she suddenly insisted on having a black cat to tie to the post. Unbeknownst to her, her father’s original purpose for tying the cat was simply practical—to keep it from causing disruptions during the ceremony. This story offers a profound lesson: rituals are often born from practical purposes, yet their true meanings can fade over time, leaving only blind adherence to tradition. Reflecting on the superstition at NYU, I wondered if it could be linked to an ancient Roman custom. The Romans had a practice where, upon the completion of an arch, the engineer responsible for its construction stood beneath it as the capstone was set in place—an act symbolizing ultimate accountability for their work. Could this old tradition echo faintly in the modern superstition of avoiding the arch? Every formula we have learned in this course is rooted in a wealth of underlying concepts. Let us remember these foundational ideas and avoid applying the formulas blindly.

text: @andrew @jkmadathil @Bharathi Professor Andrew Thangaraj’s inspiring address at the G20 summit drew me to join this Data Science program — not just for the joy of solving problems, but to truly understand the challenges our education system faces in shaping the next generation. Yesterday, while my son was helping me clear some messages on my phone, he came across a few promotional texts and asked, “Dad, if you’re learning how to make machines intelligent from data, how come you’re still getting these irrelevant messages even after a year at this institute? The juice vendor at the beach knows exactly what you like as soon as you show up — and he’s not even literate!” He made a valid point. While deep research into the mysteries of our world is essential, it’s equally important that we apply what we learn in meaningful, everyday ways — creating smarter, more thoughtful systems that reflect the intelligence we strive for. A humble suggestion: let’s make better use of simple tools to filter communications and target only relevant recipients, based on their current status. It not only helps us practice what we preach but also sets a better example of how intelligence from data can improve real-life interactions. image 956×960 168 KB

text: image 1249×855 67.6 KB EDIT: Well, the original post has been flagged into oblivion—perhaps too powerful for mere mortals to comprehend. It’s fascinating how certain truths become ‘inappropriate’ the moment they step into the wrong ears. But alas, the world must be protected from dangerous ideas. EDIT CONTINUES: Now, about these “some” people—beings of unparalleled intellect, architects of industry wisdom, custodians of what qualifies as a ‘real’ education. With their foresight, they don’t just build careers; they sculpt the very perception of them. And if your path dares to deviate from the hallowed corridors of traditional academia, well, good luck, because the whispers of “some” travel far and fast. GETTING TO THE END: The moral of the story? The game isn’t just about skill—it’s about narrative. And right now, we’re the underdogs in a tale being written by those who already sit atop the throne. But history has a way of turning pages, and when the time comes, let’s make sure we write our own chapters. LAST EDIT: If you visit the campus, you’ll find that not all doors swing open for you. But the trees? The breeze? The sky? Nature is far less judgmental. (Surely this is still allowed? ) What is “some”? —— Slightly Omniscient, Mostly Egotistical. text: Wow! Disclaimer: Not intended to harm anyone Yup, it’s tough for the Indian education system to handle this catastrophe—watching new definitions of achievement unfold before their eyes. And I totally get it—giving this prestige to a first-year student might not sit well with many. No worries, I’m a first-year student, and I won’t “disturb” the IITM campus, as we BS students are no longer  with iitm card and we dont diserve in first year too , But what truly saddens me is seeing our own campus mates questioning our place. Yes, I understand that our intellect didn’t match theirs in JEE. But is JEE the only measure of one’s ability to contribute to humanity? If a student from our program proves themselves after the first year, earns a solid CGPA, and masters the rigor of the coursework, then isn’t he just as deserving? After all, we aren’t taking online exams from the comfort of home, nor are we being handed free marks. And in the end— don’t worry. The sheer rigor of this program filters out the weak. Those who persist will not just graduate; they will contribute to the legacy of IITM itself. Our seniors from this course have already set things in motion, igniting a fire. Students from our program are winning major hackathons, and mark my words—one day, an IITM BS student will build a unicorn startup and hire the best minds of India. Who knows? Maybe that day isn’t too far away.

text: When you have already found the right singular vector v and want to find the left singular vector u , then u = \frac{1}{\sigma} Av But if you have worked out the left singular vector u and want to find the right singular vector v , then v = \frac{1}{\sigma} A^Tu P.S. text: Subject: Request for Fair Evaluation Regarding Faulty Python Exam Question I am writing this to express my deep concern and disappointment regarding one of the Python questions in our recent exam. The issue lies not with the students, but with the incorrect way the question was provided. The syntax and structure given in the problem caused confusion and multiple errors, even when the logic was absolutely correct. In my case (and many of my classmates’), I initially attempted the question using list comprehension — which should’ve worked perfectly for such a simple task. However, due to the way the problem was structured, we kept receiving type errors. I then tried using a basic for loop with for i in strings, which also failed due to the same faulty input. After wasting more than half an hour trying every possible correction, I ended up submitting a version that I knew wasn’t logically ideal, simply because I had no other option. Now we are being told that the question had some issues and it has been corrected. The new rule is that our submitted code will be tested again, and marks will be given only if it passes now. With all due respect, this approach is unfair. The original error was not ours — it was in the question itself. We wrote the right logic but were misled by the incorrect format. What about the students who passed the course but scored low due to this error? And even more importantly, what about those who failed only because of this one 20-mark question and now have to repeat the course? Therefore, I humbly request one of the following: Either full bonus marks (20) should be given to everyone for that question, OR You review the screen recordings to see who all had attempted the logic correctly, even if their final submission was affected by the error. This is not just about marks, it’s about fairness. I hope you will take this matter seriously and consider the impact this has had on many sincere students. Sincerely,

text: Request for Fair Evaluation – OPPE 2 (20-mark Question Discrepancy) Dear Course Team and fellow learners, I would like to bring to your attention a critical issue faced by several students in the recent OPPE 2 exam, specifically with one of the 20-mark coding questions. The function defined in the question prompt had an incorrect parameter, and due to that — along with a mismatch in the Python version/interface used during the exam — many of our correct solutions failed to pass the test cases. Several students, including myself, wrote logically correct and executable code that runs successfully in a standard Python environment (like Python 3.10+). However, because of technical limitations in the exam interface and the mistake in the question itself, we are now being awarded 0 marks for a question we solved correctly. This is disheartening, especially considering it was a 20-mark question — a significant weightage — and the issue was not on the student’s end. I kindly request the course team to consider awarding full  marks to all students who attempted this question with correct logic, irrespective of the test case outputs. This would ensure fairness and uphold the academic integrity of the evaluation. Hoping for a positive resolution.

text: Dear BDM Team, I’m facing a serious issue with the Week 3 graded assignment for BA. Even though I had submitted the assignment well before the deadline and had received my marks for it, I noticed today that both my submission and the marks have disappeared from the portal. I am absolutely sure that I submitted it on time, as I clearly remember doing it myself. This is not just a minor glitch—something seems to be seriously wrong on the backend. What’s more concerning is that I’m not the only one facing this. Several students have reported similar problems regarding their submissions and marks being erased or not reflecting properly. text: image 1381×1251 53.7 KB image 1409×832 92.1 KB @deepbist here in the above question the correct answer as per the question paper is MethodTwo() but from my understanding it should’ve been methodone() similary in this below question from MAY2024 QDF2 image 1471×1361 59.3 KB image 904×518 91.3 KB The answer should’ve been methodOne() if i am wrong then please give an explanation about the answer as i am not able to understand the given answers . Thank You
title: Discourse Topic: 172483 Post 1 by 23f2003824

text: When a method is called/invoked, it’s activation record is pushed into the stack and the moment it returns its value, the activation record is popped out. For the second question, before you entered line 15, the activation record for methodThree was on top. On executing line 15, the record for methodOne will be pushed in the stack. After line 15, the execution of line will be in the order: 15 → 2 →  … → 4 → 7 → … → 9 → 5 → 6 → 16 → 17 Here we can see before we reach line 16, the methodOne has been executed completely and its activation record will be popped out from the stack, and record for methodThree be there on top of stack. Same applies for the first question also. For detailed solution, please refer to: May’24 | ET QP Solution Timestamp: 53:30

text: Ok sir, got it thank you very much for a detailed explanation.

text:
Hi, please find below the correct code for Q8. If you have doubts regarding other questions, please share your code. import sys
import os
import psycopg2

file = open("id.txt", "r")
x = file.read()


try:
    connection = psycopg2.connect(
        database = sys.argv[1],
        user = os.environ.get('PGUSER'),
        password = os.environ.get('PGPASSWORD'),
        host = os.environ.get('PGHOST'),
        port = os.environ.get('PGPORT'))
    cursor = connection.cursor()
    query = f"select email from users where user_id = '{x}'" 
    cursor.execute(query)
    result = cursor.fetchall()
    for res in result:
        print(res[0])
        
    cursor.close()
except(Exception, psycopg2.DatabaseError) as error:
    print(error)
finally:
    connection.close()

text: itzzalexisabraham: difference you need to convert thet toal time into mins first then get abs diff between time in mins, then convert back to hours and mins.. Eg: time diff between : 5:30 and 6:45 convert 5:30 to minutes - 5x60+30=330 mins convert 6:45 to minutes - 6x60+45= 405 mins abs diff = 75 mins now convert to hrs: 75 mins//60 = 1 Hr convert to mins : 75%60= 15 mins so the diff is 1:15 mins.. i hope this helps..

text: The equation form given is kind of same. For a single sample with true label y \in \{0, 1\} and a probability estimate p = Pr(y=1) ,  the log loss is: L(y,p) = - (y\log (p) + (1-y) \log (1-P)) The above form can be simplified to -y \log( p) where p is the probability of y=1 .

text: Mock Exam: Tools in Data Science The end term and the mock has been created using the TDS GPT Assistant. Since the GPT has ALL the GAs, Course Content Modules, Live Session Transcriptions (its works like RAG), it is really able to help you prepare for the end term. Use it! Therefore you can also create your own mocks. ChatGPT ChatGPT - IITM TDS Teaching Assistant TA for IIT Madras' Data Science course, guiding students with questions. Below are variant questions across various topics relevant to the course. These questions have been curated from the topics areas we are focussing on. Therefore it will be very similar in content to the end term. What it does not contain: Scenario based questions. These are complex to construct. We will address the topics for these questions in the live session. LLMs Pandas Git, Docker, Bash Q1: HTTP Method Semantics Which HTTP method is not idempotent , meaning repeated identical requests may result in different outcomes each time? A. GET B. PUT C. POST D. DELETE Answer : C. POST Q2: IDE Features Which feature is least likely to be found in a standard code editor or IDE? A. Code formatting tools B. Integrated terminal C. Git integration D. Cloud hosting of Docker containers Answer : D. Cloud hosting of Docker containers Q3: Pandas Summary Methods You have a DataFrame with a region column. To get a quick summary of how many entries are in each region, which method is most useful? A. df.describe() B. df[“region”].value_counts() C. df.count() D. df.groupby(“region”).sum() Answer : B. df[“region”].value_counts() Q4: Python Exception Scope You want to safely open a file, handle any errors, and ensure the file is always closed in Python. Which pattern should you use? A. try: open(...) then finally: close() B. open() and then except C. open() and then raise D. Use with open(...) as f: block Answer : D. Use with open(...) as f: block Q5: Chrome DevTools - Debugging A frontend developer wants to trace JavaScript function calls step-by-step. Which Chrome DevTools panel should they use? A. Console B. Application C. Sources D. Elements Answer : C. Sources Q6: Data Cleaning Tools You are cleaning survey responses and want to automatically match similar text entries like “NYC”, “New York City”, and “newyorkcity”. Which approach/tool would be most effective? A. TRIM() in Excel B. Manual Find and Replace C. Fuzzy matching or clustering in OpenRefine D. COUNTIF() Answer : C. Fuzzy matching or clustering in OpenRefine Q7: Geospatial Libraries Which pair of Python libraries is best suited for geospatial analysis and rendering static maps ? A. pandas and seaborn B. geopandas and matplotlib C. folium and flask D. sklearn and dash Answer : B. geopandas and matplotlib Q8: Statistical Significance A psychologist tests if a training program changes memory performance and finds a p-value of 0.08 . What can be concluded at the 0.05 significance level? A. The result is highly significant B. The null hypothesis must be rejected C. There is insufficient evidence to reject the null hypothesis D. The program is proven to work Answer : C. There is insufficient evidence to reject the null hypothesis Q9: Purpose of Kumu What is a key use case for a tool like Kumu ? A. Animating time series B. Designing deep learning models C. Visualizing stakeholder networks and system relationships D. Performing statistical analysis Answer : C. Visualizing stakeholder networks and system relationships Q10: DevTools Performance Diagnostics To diagnose a slow webpage, you want to analyze scripts, rendering times, and long tasks . Which DevTools panel provides a timeline-based view? A. Elements B. Performance C. Network D. Lighthouse Answer : B. Performance Q11: Git Configuration Which of the following files helps configure a Git project’s name, email, and default branch? A. .gitignore B. .gitattributes C. .git/config D. README.md Answer : C. .git/config Q13: Safe HTTP Method Which HTTP method is considered safe , meaning it is only used for retrieval and must not change server state? A. GET B. DELETE C. PATCH D. POST Answer : A. GET Q14: Deduplicating Text Entries A dataset has entries like “IBM”, “I.B.M.”, and “International Business Machines”. What is the best tool to cluster these for cleaning? A. Excel TRIM B. OpenRefine using key collision or fingerprinting C. pandas merge() D. CONCATENATE() Answer : B. OpenRefine using key collision or fingerprinting Q15: Geospatial + Interactive Mapping A conservation biologist wants to visualize real-time animal tracking data on an interactive map. Which libraries would be best? A. geopandas and plotly B. folium and pandas C. seaborn and shapely D. rasterio and altair Answer : B. folium and pandas Q16: Pandas - Filtering Unique Entries You have a DataFrame of customer orders and want to list only those customers who ordered once . Which Pandas method chain is most suitable? A. df.groupby(“customer”).sum() B. df[“customer”].value_counts() == 1 C. df.drop_duplicates() D. df[“customer”].nunique() Answer : B. df[“customer”].value_counts() == 1 Q17: Purpose of Kumu in System Design How does Kumu help in system design or stakeholder mapping? A. Organizing spreadsheets B. Identifying leverage points in complex systems through visual maps C. Rendering line graphs D. Sending notifications Answer : B. Identifying leverage points in complex systems through visual maps Q18: Python Exception - Multiple Handlers Which structure allows Python to handle different types of exceptions separately? A. try … finally B. if … else C. Multiple except blocks D. Nested try blocks Answer : C. Multiple except blocks Q19: Understanding Statistical Power If a study has low statistical power , what is most likely to occur? A. False positive (Type I error) B. False negative (Type II error) C. Confounding D. Multicollinearity Answer : B. False negative (Type II error) Q20: Git Basics - Staging Area Which Git command moves modified files to the staging area ? A. git push B. git add C. git fetch D. git init Answer : B. git add Q21: Chrome DevTools - Local Storage Where can you inspect local storage items (e.g. tokens, preferences) in Chrome DevTools? A. Console B. Application > Local Storage C. Elements D. Sources Answer : B. Application > Local Storage Q22: Chrome DevTools - JS Performance Which DevTools feature helps measure execution time of scripts and CPU usage? A. Console B. Network C. Performance D. Application Answer : C. Performance Q23: Excel Data Import - Scientific Notation Issue You import a CSV file where product IDs like "1E10" are being interpreted as scientific notation in Excel. What is the best way to preserve these IDs as text? A. Format the column as General B. Use =TEXT(A1, "0") after import C. Set column format to Text during import or Text-to-Columns D. Change regional settings Answer : C. Set column format to Text during import or Text-to-Columns Module: Everyday Tools Q1: Spreadsheet Functions You have a dataset in Excel where column A contains full names in the format “Last Name, First Name”. Which function can you use to extract the first name into a separate column? A. =LEFT(A1, FIND(",", A1)-1) B. =RIGHT(A1, LEN(A1) - FIND(",", A1)) C. =MID(A1, FIND(",", A1)+2, LEN(A1)) D. =SPLIT(A1, ",") Answer : C — The MID function extracts text from the middle of a string. By finding the position of the comma and adding 2 (to skip the comma and space), it extracts the first name. Option A extracts the last name, Option B results in an error due to incorrect syntax, and Option D is not a valid Excel function. Module: Data Sourcing Q2: Web Scraping Ethics When performing web scraping to collect data, which of the following practices is considered unethical? A. Respecting the website’s robots.txt file. B. Sending requests at a rate that mimics human browsing behavior. C. Scraping data from a website that requires login without permission. D. Citing the source of the data collected. Answer : C — Scraping data from a website that requires login without permission violates the site’s terms of service and user privacy. Options A, B, and D are ethical practices that respect the website’s policies and data ownership. Module: Data Preparation Q3: Handling Missing Data In a dataset, you notice that several entries in the “Age” column are missing. Which method is generally not appropriate for handling these missing values? A. Replacing missing values with the mean age. B. Deleting rows with missing age values. C. Replacing missing values with a fixed age, such as 0. D. Leaving the missing values as they are without any action. Answer : D — Leaving missing values unaddressed can lead to errors in analysis and modeling. Options A, B, and C are common strategies for handling missing data, depending on the context and the extent of the missingness. Module: Data Analysis Q4: Statistical Measures Which of the following statistical measures is not sensitive to extreme values (outliers) in a dataset? A. Mean B. Median C. Standard Deviation D. Range Answer : B — The median represents the middle value of a dataset and is not affected by outliers. In contrast, the mean, standard deviation, and range can be significantly influenced by extreme values. Module: Large Language Models Q5: Tokenization in NLP In Natural Language Processing, what is the primary purpose of tokenization? A. To translate text from one language to another. B. To split text into individual words or subwords. C. To encrypt text for secure communication. D. To summarize large texts into shorter versions. Answer : B — Tokenization involves breaking down text into smaller components, such as words or subwords, which can then be processed by language models. This is a fundamental step in NLP tasks. Module: Geospatial and Network Analysis Q6: Geographic Coordinate Systems Which of the following coordinate systems is commonly used to represent locations on Earth’s surface? A. Cartesian Coordinate System B. Polar Coordinate System C. Geographic Coordinate System (Latitude and Longitude) D. Cylindrical Coordinate System Answer : C — The Geographic Coordinate System uses latitude and longitude to specify locations on Earth’s surface. This system is widely used in geospatial analysis. Module: Data Visualization Q7: Effective Data Visualization When creating a bar chart to compare the sales performance of different products, which practice should be avoided? A. Ordering bars from highest to lowest value. B. Using different colors for each bar without a legend. C. Starting the y-axis at zero. D. Labeling each bar with its exact value. Answer : B — Using different colors for each bar without a legend can confuse the audience, as they may assume the colors represent different categories. Consistency and clarity are key in effective data visualization. Module: Everyday Tools Q8: VS Code Feature Use You are editing a Python script in Visual Studio Code and want to quickly find and edit all occurrences of a variable name in the current file. What feature should you use? A. Git integration B. Debug panel C. Multi-cursor editing D. Terminal commands Answer : C — Multi-cursor editing allows you to place multiple cursors in a file and edit text in multiple locations at once. It is useful for refactoring variable names or repeated patterns. Module: Data Sourcing Q9: Data API Identification Which of the following data sources is most likely to provide structured data accessible via an API? A. A scanned PDF document B. A screenshot of a chart C. The World Bank data portal D. A newspaper article Answer : C — The World Bank data portal provides structured datasets accessible via APIs. The other options involve unstructured or image-based content not suitable for direct data access. Module: Data Preparation Q10: Data Type Conversion in Excel You imported a CSV file into Excel, and one of the columns containing numbers is treated as text. What is the easiest way to convert it into numeric format? A. Use the CONCAT function B. Format the column as Text C. Use the VALUE() function D. Use SUBSTITUTE() Answer : C — The VALUE function converts text that appears as numbers into actual numeric values. This is useful when data is imported with formatting issues. Module: Data Analysis Q11: Outlier Detection You are analyzing a dataset of employee salaries. Which visualization is best for quickly identifying outliers? A. Line chart B. Box plot C. Histogram D. Pie chart Answer : B — A box plot clearly shows the spread of data and highlights outliers as individual points beyond the whiskers. Module: Large Language Models Q12: Prompt Engineering Strategy To get consistent, structured responses from a language model when extracting key information, which approach is most effective? A. Ask the model to “summarize” the text B. Use open-ended questions C. Use system messages and JSON schema formatting D. Provide only one-word inputs Answer : C — System messages and structured output formats like JSON schemas guide the model to generate reliable and consistent structured responses. Module: Geospatial and Network Analysis Q13: Network Centrality In a social network graph of coworkers, which metric best identifies the person who connects the most groups together? A. Degree centrality B. Closeness centrality C. Betweenness centrality D. Eigenvector centrality Answer : C — Betweenness centrality measures how often a node appears on shortest paths between other nodes, highlighting connectors or “bridges” in the network. Module: Data Visualization Q14: Choosing the Right Chart You want to show how the composition of a marketing budget changes across three years. Which visualization is most appropriate? A. Pie charts for each year B. Scatter plots C. Stacked bar chart D. Line chart Answer : C — A stacked bar chart shows parts of a whole across different categories and time periods, making it easier to compare budget composition over years.

title: Discourse Topic: 172070 Post 4 by 24ds3000006

text: To find the power of the test against the alternative H_A: p \neq 0.5 , we first need to understand the rejection region defined by the test. The test rejects H_0 if |X - 300| > 50 , which translates to: X < 250 \quad \text{or} \quad X > 350 Given that X \sim \text{Binomial}(100, p) , we can standardize X to use the normal approximation for large n : Z = \frac{X - np}{\sqrt{np(1-p)}} For our case, n = 100 and np = 100p . Thus, the mean and variance of X are: \mu = 100p, \quad \sigma^2 = 100p(1-p) Now, we need to find the power of the test, which is the probability of rejecting H_0 when H_A is true. This can be expressed as: P(X < 250 \text{ or } X > 350 \mid p) Using the normal approximation, we can calculate: For X < 250 : P(X < 250) = P\left(Z < \frac{250 - 100p}{\sqrt{100p(1-p)}}\right) For X > 350 : P(X > 350) = P\left(Z > \frac{350 - 100p}{\sqrt{100p(1-p)}}\right) = 1 - P\left(Z < \frac{350 - 100p}{\sqrt{100p(1-p)}}\right) Now, we can combine these probabilities: P(X < 250 \text{ or } X > 350) = P(X < 250) + P(X > 350) Substituting the expressions we derived: = P\left(Z < \frac{250 - 100p}{\sqrt{100p(1-p)}}\right) + \left(1 - P\left(Z < \frac{350 - 100p}{\sqrt{100p(1-p)}}\right)\right) This simplifies to: = P\left(Z < \frac{250 - 100p}{\sqrt{100p(1-p)}}\right) + 1 - P\left(Z < \frac{350 - 100p}{\sqrt{100p(1-p)}}\right) Using the cumulative distribution function F_Z : = F_Z\left(\frac{250 - 100p}{\sqrt{100p(1-p)}}\right) + 1 - F_Z\left(\frac{350 - 100p}{\sqrt{100p(1-p)}}\right) Now, we can express this in terms of the standard normal variable Z : = F_Z\left(\frac{250 - 100p}{10\sqrt{p(1-p)}}\right) + 1 - F_Z\left(\frac{350 - 100p}{10\sqrt{p(1-p)}}\right) Finally, we can rewrite the power of the test as: = 1 + F_Z\left(\frac{250 - 100p}{10\sqrt{p(1-p)}}\right) - F_Z\left(\frac{350 - 100p}{10\sqrt{p(1-p)}}\right) Thus, the power of the test against the alternative \text{Binomial}(100, p) is: \boxed{1 + F_Z\left(\frac{25 - 10p}{\sqrt{p(1-p)}}\right) - F_Z\left(\frac{35 - 10p}{\sqrt{p(1-p)}}\right)} Hope it helps you.

text: Use the fact that the sum of the eigenvalues of A is equal to the trace of the matric A and the product of the eigenvalues =\det A . 1 is already an eigenvalue. If the other two eigenvalues are \lambda_1 and \lambda_2 , then \lambda_1+\lambda_2  + 1= 3, \quad \lambda_1\lambda_2 = 2 which gives \lambda_1+\lambda_2=2 and \lambda_1\lambda_2=2 . So \lambda_1 , \lambda_2 are the roots of a quadratic \lambda^2-(\lambda_1+\lambda_2)\lambda + \lambda_1\lambda_2 =0 \Rightarrow \lambda^2-2\lambda + 2=0 This gives the roots as 1\pm i . Hence, the other two eigenvalues are 1+i , and 1-i . Since, there are three distinct eigenvalues, the matrix is diagonalizable.

title: Discourse Topic: 172505 Post 3 by Sara1

text: image 564×260 3.1 KB If you swap non-conflicting instructions in S1 in the image above you are able to get schedule S2 on right, this makes both the schedules conflict equivalent. For checking view equivalency we just have to check initial read, final write and updated read condition: The initial read of data item X is done by T1 in both S1 and S2 and initial read of data item Y is done by T3 in both S1 and S2 The final write on data item X is done by T2 in both the schedules and final write on data item Y is done by T1 in both the schedules. T2 reads the value of data item X that is being written by T1 in both the schedules and T1 reads the value of data item Y that is being written by T3 in both the schedules. So this makes both the schedules view equivalent as well.

text: My specific doubt is on the topic: matrix My doubt is:  pls help in how to approch this sums Recommended: Mention what you have done till now to find clarification on the doubt: Screenshot (3179) 923×1080 97.6 KB Procedure updateMatrix(AM) tempMat = AM foreach i in rows (AM) { foreach j in columns (AM) { foreach k in columns (AM) { if(AM[i][k] == 1 and AM [k][j]==1) { tempMat[i][j] = 1 } } } } return (tempMat) End updateMatrix what will be the values of a and b at the end of the execution of the pseudocode given below:- newMatrix= updateMatrix(M) a =  newMatrix [1] [3] b =  newMatrix [4] [5] Options: 6406532326971. a = 1 b = 1 6406532326972. a = 0 b = 1 6406532326973. a = 1 b = 0 6406532326974. a = 0 b = 0 given ans is a=0  b=1 but i am getting a=0  b=0 what will be the values of a and b at the end of the execution of the pseudocode given below:- newMatrix1=  updateMatrix(M) newMatrix2 = updateMatrix (newMatrix1) a =newMatrix2 [1] [3] b = newMatrix2 [4] [5] Options: 6406532326975. a = 0 b = 0 6406532326976. a = 1 b = 0 6406532326977. a = 0 b = 1 6406532326978. a = 1 b = 1 given ans:-  a=0 b=1 pls help me how to solve
title: Discourse Topic: 172374 Post 1 by 24f3000219

text: Hi!! Here u r computing at most one hop in the first code, see the line: tempMat = AM copies the direct matrix from any i to j now,  this condition: if(AM[i][k] == 1 and AM [k][j]==1) tells u about the one hop: why bcz, u can see that u r going from i->k->j, so there is only one stop “k” b/w i and j, hence, this tells u about the one hop route, now the line, tempMat[i][j] = 1 tells u that there exists a direct edge b/w i and j so this is the direct route from i to j. So, now if we look into the first question, newMatrix= updateMatrix(M) a = newMatrix [1] [3] b = newMatrix [4] [5], they are asking for atmost 1 hop, but u see there is no way u r able to teach from 1->3 in either o or 1 hop, so it returns 0, but from 4->5 there exists a 0 hop route, that is, a direct edge, so b=1. Now, in the second question: newMatrix1= updateMatrix(M) newMatrix2 = updateMatrix (newMatrix1) a =newMatrix2 [1] [3] b = newMatrix2 [4] [5], if u look a bit carefully then u will fins that the one hop matrix is being copied again in the 2nd line, so it suggests atmost 2 hop, now, a=0 and b=1 , and regarding your first answer u r getting is correct, no worries!! This was all from my side. All the best!!

text: Hi, Screenshot 2025-04-12 at 14.32.10 1622×1166 32.4 KB From the above pic, we can see that there is a RW from T1 to T3 and RW conflict from T3 to T2 (I’m not counting all the conflicts here, just taking the ones that are needed to form the graph edges). T1 -------> T3 --------> T2 No cycle so it is conflict serializable Now, for the locks part, we can see that the once the shrinking phase starts none of the transactions go back to growing phase, so that means it is two phase lockable. Here if you see just above the shrinking phase of T3, we have locked A - this is because we need to release the lock on B for T2. So if we release B without locking A, then it will violate Two phase locking. So we lock A first and then release B. About strict two phase locking, from what I understand, the locks should be held until the transaction commits. Here that’s not the case. The locks of T2 and T3 are released before commit. So I’m not sure why that option is marked right. Hope this helps!
title: Discourse Topic: 172522 Post 2 by 24f1002163

text: Strict 2PL only requires that exclusive locks are held until commit/abort. In this case, the only lock released before commit is a shared lock on B by T3, so it’s valid.

A similar question was in Quiz1 and TA stated the following that eigen vectors of K and C will not be the same. image 1162×199 32.8 KB @23f1001171 @22f3001517 @PulkitMangal can someone explain this please before the quiz?
title: Discourse Topic: 172410 Post 1 by RajaS

text: I got the explanation… That’s the basic things of PCA… Sorry for bothering you all..
title: Discourse Topic: 172410 Post 2 by RajaS

text: The eigen vectors of X^TX and XX^T will be different because they both lies in different space. Assuming X to be of shape d \times n ( d features and n samples), eigen vectors of XX^T will lie in \mathbb{R^d} while for X^TX it will lie in \mathbb{R}^n . So eigen vectors of \mathbf{XX}^T and \mathbf{X}^T \mathbf{X} will not be same Now coming to the question, the given kernel matrix is X^TX which is basically using the linear kernel so there will be no mapping to higher dimension. But for finding the principal direction we use eigen vectors of this kernel matrix to find eigen vectors of covariance matrix. Specifically: If v is an eigenvector of X^TX then Xv is an eigenvector of XX^T . So, the directions (in original space) will be the same.

text: Hi, If the first array has m elements and second array has n elements, max comparisons = m+n-1. Here it is mentioned that the merge will combine arrays pairwise. To do it optimally, first sort the arrays based on their size, so that we can reduce the number of comparisons. So  - 5,10,12,15,16. Now take the first two arrays - max comparisons = 5 + 10 -1 = 14. when we combine the first two arrays - total elements = 15. Now again pick the two arrays which have smaller number of elements -that will be the combined array with 15 elements and the array with 12 elements. Total comparisons = 12 + 15 - 1 = 26. Total elements in the combined array = 27. Now our array list looks like = 27, 15,16. Now pick 15 and 16 to combine. Tot comparisons = 15 + 16 - 1 = 30.Total elems = 31. Now finally combine 31 and 27. Total comparisons = 31 + 27 -1  = 57 and total elements = 58. Sum of comparisons = 14 + 26 + 30 + 57 = 127. Hope this helps!

text:
You have to do a 3 degree polynomial transformation which is given by k(x, y) = (1 + x^Ty)^3 But one more argument is given in the PolynomialFeatures that is interaction_only=True . This will result to exclusion of any single variable having degree more than 1 . The following are the rule for this param: 1  \ \rightarrow  \text{included} \\\\
x \ \rightarrow  \text{included} \\\\

x y  \ \rightarrow  \text{included} \\\\

x^2y  \ \rightarrow  \text{not included} \\\\

xy^3  \ \rightarrow  \text{not included} \\\\ And so on..

text: Suppose the height of the B-Tree given is 3 B - Tree, height = 3 and order = 25, 80% full so order = 20 level 1 - root node - min children = 2 and min key = 1 so root node can hold 1 key at minimum level 2 - non root nodes - 2 nodes - each node will hold at minimum 20/2 children which is 10 children and 9 keys, so total number of keys at this level = 9 keys each x 2 nodes in total = 18 keys. level 3 - non root nodes - 20 nodes - each node will hold at minimum 20/2 children which is 10 children and 9 keys so,  total number of keys at this level would be = 9 keys each x 20 nodes in total = 180 keys So the minimum number of keys which can be accommodated in a B-Tree of order 25 which 80% full and whose height is 3 is 1 + 18 + 180 = 199 keys in total.

title: Discourse Topic: 172448 Post 1 by 23f2001123

text: Caution:- THESE ARE THE INFO AVAILABLE ON INTERNET If you have mistakenly applied for a new e-PAN card for your mother while she already has an existing PAN card, you can follow these steps to cancel the new application: Contact the Income Tax Department Helpline Reach out to the Income Tax Department’s helpline for assistance with canceling the new e-PAN application. You can call their toll-free numbers: 1800 103 0025 1800 419 0025 Alternatively, you can email your query to efilingwebmanager@incometax.gov.in. Provide the acknowledgment number received via SMS and explain that the application was submitted in error. They will guide you on the next steps. Use the NSDL Portal for PAN Cancellation If the new e-PAN has already been issued, you can surrender it by following these steps: Visit the official NSDL portal. Select “Services” > “PAN” > “Changes or Correction in existing PAN data.” Choose “Changes or Correction in existing PAN Data/ Reprint of PAN Card (No changes in existing PAN Data)” under “Application Type.” Fill out the form, mentioning the PAN you wish to surrender, and submit it. Submit a Letter to Your Local Assessing Officer If online cancellation is not possible, draft a letter to your local Income Tax Assessing Officer requesting cancellation of the duplicate PAN. Include: Details of both PAN cards (existing and newly applied). A copy of both PAN cards (if available). A declaration stating that your mother wishes to retain her original PAN issued in 2013. Monitor Status You can check the status of your cancellation request by visiting the NSDL or Income Tax Department website. Use your acknowledgment number to track progress. Important Notes Holding multiple PAN cards is a violation under Section 139A of the Income Tax Act and may attract a penalty of ₹10,000 under Section 272B. Ensure this issue is resolved promptly. If you face any challenges, you can also visit your nearest NSDL collection center or contact them at +91-20-27218080 for further assistance. By following these steps, you should be able to cancel the new e-PAN application successfully.

text:
I am writing to bring to your attention an issue many students encountered in Section 2 of today’s OPPE (09:30-11:30 A2) due to a problem with the preset code. The function in the question was as follows: def count_str_with_lengths_3_or_5(strings: list[str]):
>>                                         ^^^
>> TypeError: 'type' object is not subscriptable Python Unless you changed this or rewrote the entire code from scratch, regardless of your answer, you would get it wrong. The reason seems to be that this was because the syntax used is valid only starting Python 3.9. Since the compiler in the exam was on an earlier version (presumably, 3.7), it resulted in an error. Many students who faced this error were unable to decipher what it meant and fix it, as it is something we haven’t encountered earlier. Hence, they lost 20 marks despite having written the correct solution code for the problem. I request the staff to kindly help out by providing a solution to those affected. Thank you!

text: Hello, I am a diploma-level student currently. I completed my foundation level in Jan 2023. However, I have not progressed much at the diploma level since then due to personal reasons, such as not being able to find the balance between work and coursework, lack of discipline and so on. I have so far completed MAD-I(Theory n Project), MAD-II(Theory), DBMS, TDS, BDM, MLF, and PDSA. I still need to complete MLT, SC, MLP(Theory n Project), Java, BA, MAD-II(Project), and BDM(Project). I now worry that I might run out of time to finish these courses. Can someone please help me with the following questions: How many more terms do I have to finish my remaining diploma courses? Any suggestions on in which order I should go with taking the courses to finish them at the earliest? Any other general advice to balance professional and academic aspects going forward? Thank you.
title: Discourse Topic: 172311 Post 1 by 22f2000784

text: 22f2000784: How many more terms do I have to finish my remaining diploma courses? If you started your diploma in the Jan 23 term, then you have already used 7 terms and have 5 more terms to finish both the diplomas. But, if you started you diploma in the May 23 term, then you have only used 6 terms and have 6 more terms to finish both the diplomas. 22f2000784: Any suggestions on in which order I should go with taking the courses to finish them at the earliest? You can finish the remaining courses in 2 terms easily. MLT is a prerequisite for MLP, so here is what I think you should take: Term 1 (May 25 term): MLT, JAVA, SC, and one project (I would recommend the BDM project with secondary route) Term 2 (Sep 25 term): MLP (Th & Pr), BA, and one remaining project. Term 1 could be a little hectic because MLT in itself requires time, and SC demands practice to clear the oppe. Java is easy in terms of theory and oppe both; if you practice pyq’s, you will score well in quizzes and end term, and If you practice the live coding questions on the portal, you will score well in oppe. The reason I have kept both the OPPE courses in term 1 is if you by chance fail in OPPE, you still have one more term to go, and you can do OPPE only in the next term as disaster management. Now, I recommend taking the BDM project in term 1 because the chances of you getting your report rejected are quite high, and the team is not at all helpful they can reject your report for the stupidest reason. So if you couldn’t complete it in the first term, you will still have a backup term in your hand. And I recommend the secondary route because you have one less submission in it, so one less report to worry about getting rejected. Now, MLP also has OPPE, but you can’t take it before completing MLT. But if you want to take it nice and easy and do it in three terms, then here is what I would recommend: Term 1 (May 25 term): MLT, BA, BDM Project Term 2 (Sep 25 term): JAVA, SC, MAD-II Project Term 3 (Jan 26 term): MLP (Th & Pr) BA is not that tough, so you can also have it in term 3 instead of term 1 if you want. 22f2000784: Any other general advice to balance professional and academic aspects going forward? Well, I cannot quite comment on this as I am a standalone student just pursuing this degree as of now. But there are many people who are currently working in the industry and pursuing this degree alongside, so I think they might be better ones to answer this. I hope this helps.

text:
L(x_1, x_2, \lambda_1, \lambda_2, \mu_1, \mu_2) =(x_1 -4)^2 + (x_2 -4)^2  + \lambda_1(6 - 2x_1 - 3x_2) + \lambda_2(3x_1 + 2 x_2 -12) KKT Conditions Stationarity : \frac{\partial L}{\partial x_1} = 2(x_1 - 4) - 2\lambda_1 + 3\lambda_2  = 0 \frac{\partial L}{\partial x_2} = 2(x_2 - 4) - 3\lambda_1 +2\lambda_2  = 0 Primal feasibility : 6 - 2x_1 - 3x_2 \leq 0 3x_1 + 2 x_2 -12 \leq 0 x_1, x_2 \geq 0 Dual feasibility : \lambda_i \geq 0 Complementary slackness : \lambda_1 (6 - 2x_1 - 3x_2)=0 \lambda_2 (3x_1 + 2 x_2 -12) = 0 \begin{gather*} 
4x_1 = 4 \lambda_1 - 6 \lambda_2 + 16\\
6x_2 = 9 \lambda_1 - 6 \lambda_2 + 24\\
6 x_2 - 4x_1 - 8 = 5 \lambda_1 \\
-6x_1 + 4x_2 + 8 = 5 \lambda_2 \\
\text{ Seeing the primal 1 let's try } \lambda_1 =0 \\ -4 x_1 + 6 x_2 = 8 & 3*(3x_1 + 2x_2 = 12)\\ (9-(-4))x_1 = 36-8 & x_1 = \frac{28}{13} \approx  2.15 \\ x_2 = \frac{8*13 +4*28}{6*13}= \frac{36}{13}  \approx 2.76& \text{ both }x_1, x_2\geq 0 \\ (\frac{-24}{13})^2  + (\frac{-16}{13})^2 =(\frac{832}{169}) \approx 4.92\\ \text{constraints✅ }12.615 \geq 6 & 0 \geq 0 & \lambda_1 = \frac{16}{13} \geq 0
\end{gather*}

title: Discourse Topic: 172421 Post 1 by 24f3004439

text: Your solution is correct. Why? if S is a solution of Ax = b . Then we can write every element of S as. S = x_p + \{x_n | \ Ax_n = 0\} Here x_p is some solution of Ax = b and x_n is solution of Ax = 0 . Solution of A_1x = b is (2-t,2-t,t) if you take t = 0 x_p = (2,2,0) Solution of A_1x = 0 is (-t,-t,t) S = (2,2,0)+ \{(-t,-t,t) | t\in R\} Hope this helps you .

text: Dear sir, ig its a bit late to ask this q but i hope i get the ans to clarify my understanding. In svm we say that the margin is formed using the closest datapoint to the linear classifier but to find the w eventually the linear classifier we do the dual problem and we get alphai xi yi and we say whose alpha i i> 0 it is  the support vector. so the support vectors are the ones whose distance is closest . but my doubt is y we take all vectors that lie on the line if they all lie on the same hyperplane every one will have the same distance from the line so taking any one support vector it will give us the margin right y take all if they are all on same hyperplane i dont understand this aphai thing y it differs if they are all one same hyperplane. pls clarify thank you @Karthik_POD @mayurg @PulkitMangal @23f1001171
title: Discourse Topic: 172328 Post 1 by 23f2005111

text: Even though all support vectors lie on the margin and are the same distance from the separating hyperplane, we need multiple support vectors because: We know, The final separating hyperplane is determined by a weighted combination of support vectors w= \sum \alpha_i y_i x_i and each support vector contributes a piece of direction and weight to build the best possible margin, so The optimizer picks different \alpha_i to balance their influence, not just based on distance, but also based on position and class.
